free_text.Learning outcomes: This course aims at providing a synthetic vision of the present state of knowledge on galaxies, which presents rapid changes thanks to recent technology development, both on the observational and computational aspects. The course plans to describe the world of galaxies from close to far away.
free_text.Content: Solar vicinity in the Milky Way[br/]Milky Way as a galaxy (spiral structure, bar bulb, center, exterior disk and halo[br/]The local group[br/]The local supercluster[br/]Glaxy cluster[br/]Large scale structures[br/][br/]Are also presented :[br/]The general properties of galaxies according to their Hubble type[br/]The main physical mechanisms (stellar formation, nucleosynthesis)[br/]Dark matter[br/][br/]Lecturer : Prof. Daniel Pfenniger, Observatoire de Genève

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: This course aims at providing a synthetic vision of the present state of knowledge on galaxies, which presents rapid changes thanks to recent technology development, both on the observational and computational aspects. The course plans to describe the world of galaxies from close to far away.
